Class I: Class I: There is a reasonable probability that the use of, or exposure to, a violative product will cause serious adverse health consequences or death
Class II: Class II: The use of, or exposure to, a violative product may cause temporary or medically reversible adverse health consequences or where the probability of serious adverse health consequences is remote
Class III: Class III: The use of, or exposure to, a violative product is not likely to cause adverse health consequences
